section.title: Overview
section.p: Log into the SM GUI, navigate to Policy & Charging Configuration > Common tab and select NRF Configurations from the hamburger menu ( ).
Select a tab you need to work on from one of the following attributes in the NRF Configurations tab to configure the attributes and make associations:

section.title: PCF INFO
section.p: Once a PCF Info is attached to an active NFProfile, the PCF Info cannot be deleted. Whereas, when a PCF Info attached to an active NFProfile is updated, the PCF Info logs an NFUpdate.
Log into the SM GUI, navigate to Policy & Charging Configuration > Common tab and select NRF Configurations from the hamburger menu ( ) and select PCF INFO tab.

To add a new PCF Info profile, click (+) to add the basic details as described in the given table: PCF INFO attributes
Attribute name
Options
Description
Mandatory/Optional
ID string
Additional PCF Info arguments in the API.
Disallow the new PCF Info creation when no attribute (except ID) is provided.
Mandatory
Rx Diameter Host
string
DiameterIdentity
This IE must be present when the PCF supports Rx interface
When present, this IE indicates the Diameter host of the Rx interface for the PCF.
Optional
Rx Diameter Realm
string
DiameterIdentity
This IE must be present when the PCF supports Rx interface
When present, this IE indicates the Diameter realm of the Rx interface for the PCF.
Optional
DNN List
array
(DNN)
DNNs supported by the PCF. Optional
Supi Ranges
array
(Supi range)
PCF Info arguments as per specifications in the API.
List of ranges of SUPIs served by the PCF instance. If not provided, then the PCF can serve any SUPI.
Optional

section.title: CHF INFO
section.p: Once a CHF Info is attached to an active NFProfile, the CHF Info cannot be deleted. Whereas, when a CHF Info attached to an active NFProfile is updated, the CHF Info logs an NFUpdate.

To add a new CHF Info profile, click (+) to add the basic details as described in the given table: CHF Info attributes
Attribute name
Options
Description
Mandatory/Optional
ID string
Additional CHF Info arguments in the API.
Disallow the new CHF Info creation when no attribute (except ID) is provided.
Mandatory
Supi Ranges
array
(Supi range)
CHF Info arguments as per specifications in the API.
List of ranges of SUPIs served by the CHF instance. If not provided, then the CHF serves any SUPI.
Optional
GPSI Range List
array
(Identity range)
CHF Info arguments as per specifications in the API.
List of ranges of GPSI served by the CHF instance. If not provided, then the CHF serves any GPSI.
Optional
PLMN Range List
array
(PLMN range)
CHF Info arguments as per specifications in the API.
List of ranges of PLMNs (including the PLMN IDs of the CHF instance) served by the CHF instance. If not provided, then the CHF serves any PLMN.
Optional

section.title: NF SERVICE
section.p: and describe the NF Service attributes.

table.title: Additional NF Service attributes in API

row.entry: Alphanumeric Id of the service instance within a given NF Instance. This allows a user friendly name to be given to an NF Service entity for easy identification.

table.title: NF Service attributes as per the specification in API

row.entry: Unique ID of the service instance within a given NF Instance.
Name of the service instance. (For example, nudm-sdm)

The API versions supported by the NF Service and if available, the corresponding retirement date of the NF Service. The different array elements that has distinct unique values for apiVersionInUri, and consequently, the values of apiFullVersion that have a unique first digit version number.
Status of the NF Service instance.
FQDN of the NF Service instance.

entry.p: If the NF service needs to be discoverable by other NFs in a different PLMN, then an FQDN used for inter PLMN routing is registered with the NRF.

A change of this attribute results in triggering a NF_PROFILE_CHANGED notification from NRF toward subscribing NFs located in a different PLMN, but the new value is notified as a change of the fqdn attribute.

row.entry: IP addresses and port information of the Network Function (including IPv4 and/or IPv6 address) where the service is listening for incoming service requests.
Optional path segments construct the apiRoot variable of the different API URIs.
Notification endpoints for different notification types.

entry.p: PLMNs allowed to access the service instance.
The absence of this attribute indicates that any PLMN is allowed to access the service instance.

When included, the allowedPlmns attribute does not include the PLMN ID(s) registered in the plmnList attribute of the NF Profile, that is the PLMN ID(s) registered in the NF Profile is considered to allow access to the service instance.
A change of this attribute does not trigger a NF_PROFILE_CHANGED notification from NRF, and this attribute is not included in profile change notifications to subscribed NFs.
Type of the NFs allowed to access the service instance.
The absence of this attribute indicates that any NF type is allowed to access the service instance.
A change of this attribute does not trigger a NF_PROFILE_CHANGED notification from NRF, and this attribute is not included in profile change notifications to subscribed NFs.
Pattern (regular expression according to the ECMA-262 dialect [8]) representing the NF domain names allowed to access the service instance.
The absence of this attribute indicates that any NF domain is allowed to access the service instance.
A change of this attribute does not trigger a NF_PROFILE_CHANGED notification from NRF, and this attribute is not included in the profile change notifications to subscribed NFs.
S-NSSAI of the allowed slices to access the service instance.
The absence of this attribute indicates that any NF domain is allowed to access the service instance.
A change of this attribute does not trigger a NF_PROFILE_CHANGED notification from NRF, and this attribute is not included in the profile change notifications to subscribed NFs.
Priority (relative to other services of the same type) in the range of 0-65535, to be used for NF Service selection; lower values indicate a higher priority.
The NRF overwrites the received priority value when exposing an NFProfile with the Nnrf_NFDiscovery service.

row.entry: Static capacity information in the range of 0-65535, expressed as a weight relative to other services of the same type.
Dynamic load information, ranged from 0 to 100, indicates the current load percentage of the NF Service.

entry.p: Timestamp when the NF service was (re)started.
The pattern of date time is yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZZZ

row.entry: Specific data for a CHF service instance.
Supported features of the NF Service instance.

section.title: NF PROFILE
section.p: and describe the NF Profile attributes.

table.title: Additional NF Profile attributes in API

entry.p: This is an alphanumeric id field that allows operators to uniquely identify the created NFProfiles . Unlike nfInstanceId (which has to follow UUID pattern), this id field has no such restriction, thereby allowing user friendly names to be associated with NFProfiles.
This is a Mandatory field and must be unique for each NFProfile.

row.entry: ID of CHFInfo entity associated with this NFProfile.
ID of PCFInfo entity associated with this NFProfile.

entry.p: Contains an array of id's of NFService is associated with this NFProfile.
At least one NFService must be associated with an NFProfile.

table.title: NF Profile attributes as per the specification in API

row.entry: Unique identity of the NF Instance.

entry.p: Time in seconds expected between two consecutive heartbeat messages from an NF Instance to the NRF.
It is included in the registration request. When present in the request it contains the heartbeat time proposed by the NF service consumer.

It is included in responses from NRF to registration requests (PUT) or in NF profile updates (PUT or PATCH). If the proposed heartbeat time is acceptable by the NRF based on the local configuration, it uses the same value as in the registration request; otherwise the NRF overrides the value using a preconfigured value.
This IE is present if this information is available for the NF.
If not provided, PLMN ID(s) of the PLMN of the NRF are assumed for the NF.
If not provided, the NF can serve any S-NSSAI.
When present this IE represents the list of S-NSSAIs supported in all the PLMNs listed in the plmnList IE.
This IE is included when the list of S-NSSAIs supported by the NF for each PLMN it is supporting is different.
When present, this IE must include the S-NSSAIs supported by the Network Function for each PLMN supported by the Network Function. When present, this IE overrides sNssais IE.
NSI identities of the Network Function.
If not provided, the NF can serve any NSI.

row.entry: FQDN of the Network Function (NOTE 1) (NOTE 2). For AMF, the FQDN registered with the NRF is that of the AMF Name (see 3GPP TS 23.003 [12] sub-clause 28.3.2.5 document).

If the NF is discoverable by other NFs in a different PLMN, then an FQDN used for inter-PLMN routing as specified in 3GPP TS 23.003 [12] document is registered with the NR F. A change of this attribute results in triggering a NF_PROFILE_CHANGED notification from NRF toward subscribing NFs located in a different PLMN, but the new value is notified as a change of the fqdn attribute.
IPv4 addresses of the Network Function.
IPv6 addresses of the Network Function.

entry.p: PLMNs allowed to access the NF instance. If not provided, any PLMN is allowed to access the NF.
A change of this attribute does not trigger a NF_PROFILE_CHANGED notification from NRF, and this attribute is not included in profile change notifications to subscribed NFs.
Type of the NFs allowed to access the NF instance.
If not provided, any NF type is allowed to access the NF.
A change of this attribute does not trigger a NF_PROFILE_CHANGED notification from NRF, and this attribute is not included in profile change notifications to subscribed NFs.
Pattern (regular expression according to the ECMA-262 dialect [8]) representing the NF domain names allowed to access the NF instance.
If not provided, any NF domain is allowed to access the NF.
A change of this attribute does not trigger a NF_PROFILE_CHANGED notification from NRF, and this attribute is not included in profile change notifications to the subscribed NFs.
This is a plain string field with no validations. This field can accept domain name patterns.
S-NSSAI of the allowed slices to access the service instance (NOTE 5).
The absence of this attribute indicates that any NF domain is allowed to access the service instance.
A change of this attribute does not trigger a NF_PROFILE_CHANGED notification from NRF, and this attribute is not included in the profile change notifications to subscribed NFs.
Priority (relative to other services of the same type) in the range of 0-65535, to be used for NF Service selection; lower values indicate a higher priority.
If priority is also present in the nfServiceList parameters, then the parameters has precedence over this value.
The NRF overwrites the received priority value when exposing an NFProfile with the Nnrf_NFDiscovery service.
Static capacity information in the range of 0-65535, expressed as a weight relative to other services of the same type.
if capacity is also present in the nfServiceList parameters, then the parameters has precedence over this value.

row.entry: Dynamic load information, ranged from 0 to 100, indicates the current load percentage of the NF.
Operator defined information about the location of the NF instance (For example, geographic location, data center).
Specific data for the UDR (ranges of SUPI, group ID and so on).
Specific data for the UDM (ranges of SUPI, group ID and so on).
Specific data for the AUSF (ranges of SUPI, group ID and so on).
Specific data for the AMF (AMF Set ID, and so on).
Specific data for the SMF (DNN's, and so on).
Specific data for the UPF (S-NSSAI, DNN, SMF serving area, interface and so on).
List of NF Service Instances. It includes the services produced by the NF discovered by other NFs, if any.
Specific data for custom Network Functions.

entry.p: NCC does not set this field automatically.
The pattern of date time is yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZZZ For example: 2019-05-02T21:29:46+0530

If present, and set to true, it indicates that the different service instances of a same NF Service in this NF instance, supporting a same API version, are capable to persist their resource state in shared storage and therefore these resources are available after a new NF service instance supporting the same API version is selected by an NF Service Consumer (see 3GPP TS 23.527 [27] document).
Otherwise, it indicates that the NF Service Instances of a same NF Service are not capable to share resource state inside the NF Instance.
NF Profile changes support indicator. This IE may be present in the NFRegister or NFUpdate (NF Profile Complete Replacement) request and is absent in the response.
true: the NF Service Consumer supports receiving NF Profile Changes in the response.
false (default): the NF Service Consumer does not support receiving NF Profile Changes in the response.
This IE is absent in the request to the NRF and may be included by the NRF in NFRegister or NFUpdate (NF Profile Complete Replacement) response.
true: the NF Profile contains NF Profile changes.

row.entry: Notification endpoints for different notification types.

table.title: Additional NF Discovery Query attributes in API
NF Discovery Query attributes as per specification in API

row.entry: This IE contains the NF type of the NF Service Producer being discovered.
This IE contains the NF type of the NF Service Consumer invoking the Nnrf_NFDiscovery service.

entry.p: If included, this IE must contain an array of service names for which the NRF is queried to provide the list of NF profiles. The NRF returns the NF profiles that have at least one NF service matching the NF service names in this list. The NF service names returned by the NRF is an intersection of the NF service names requested and the NF service names registered in the NF profile.
If not included, the NRF returns all the NF service names registered in the NF profile.

row.entry: If included, this IE contains the FQDN of the NF Service Consumer invoking the Nnrf_NFDiscovery service. The NRF uses this to return only those NF profiles that include at least one NF service which contains an entry in the allowedNfDomains list that matches the domain of the requester NF.

This IE is included when NF services are in a different PLMN, or NF services of specific PLMN ID(s) in a same PLMN comprising multiple PLMN IDs, need to be discovered. When included, this IE contains the PLMN ID of the target NF. If more than one PLMN ID is included, NFs from any PLMN ID present in the list matches the query parameter.
This IE is included when NF services are in a different PLMN is discovered. When included, this IE contains the PLMN ID(s) of the requester NF.
Identity of the NF instance being discovered.
FQDN of the target NF instance being discovered.

If included, this IE contains the API URI of the NFDiscovery Service of the home NRF. It is included if the NF Service Consumer has previously received such API URI to be used for service discovery (For example: from the NSSF in the home PLMN).

If included, this IE contains the list of S-NSSAI served by the services being discovered. The NRF uses this to identify the NF services that have registered their support for these S-NSSAIs. The NRF returns the NF profiles that have at least one S-NSSAI matching the S-NSSAIs in this list. The S-NSSAIs included in the NF profile returned by the NRF is an intersection of the S-NSSAIs requested and the S-NSSAIs registered in the NF profile.

If included, this IE contains the list of S-NSSAI served by the NF service being discovered for the corresponding PLMN provided. The NRF uses this to identify the NF services that have registered their support for the S-NSSAIs for the corresponding PLMN given. The NRF returns the NF profiles that have at least one per PLMN S-NSSAI entry matching the PLMN-specific S-NSSAIs provided in this list. The per PLMN list of S-NSSAIs included in the NF profile returned by the NRF is an intersection of the list requested and the list registered in the NF profile.
If included, this IE contains the list of NSI IDs served by the services being discovered.

If included, this IE contains the DNN for which NF services serving that DNN is discovered. DNN is included if the target NF type is BSF, SMF or UPF. If the Snssai(s) are also included, the NF services serving the DNN is available in the network slice(s) identified by the Snssai(s).
If included, this IE contains the serving area of the SMF. It is included if the target NF type is UPF.
Guami used to search for an appropriate AMF.
If included, this IE contains the SUPI of the requester UE to search for an appropriate NF. SUPI is included if the target NF type is PCF, CHF, AUSF, UDM or UDR.
The IPv4 address of the UE for which a BSF needs to be discovered.
The IPv4 address domain of the UE for which a BSF needs to be discovered.
The IPv6 prefix of the UE for which a BSF needs to be discovered.

entry.p: When present, this IE indicates whether a combined SMF/PGW-C or a standalone SMF is discovered.
true: A combined SMF/PGW-C is requested to be discovered;
false: A standalone SMF is requested to be discovered.

row.entry: If included, this IE contains the PGW FQDN which is received by the AMF from the MME to find the combined SMF/PGW.
If included, this IE contains the GPSI of the requester UE to search for an appropriate NF. GPSI is included if the target NF type is CHF, UDM or UDR.
If included, this IE contains the external group identifier of the requester UE to search for an appropriate NF. This is included if the target NF type is UDM or UDR.
Indicates the data set to be supported by the NF to be discovered. May be included if the target NF type is UDR.

Routing Indicator information that allows to route network signaling with SUCI (see 3GPP TS 23.003 [12] document) to an AUSF and UDM instance capable to serve the subscriber. May be included if the target NF type is AUSF or UDM.
Identity of the group(s) of the NFs of the target NF type to be discovered. May be included if the target NF type is UDR, UDM or AUSF.
If included, this IE contains the Data network access identifiers. It may be included if the target NF type is UPF.

entry.p: When present, this IE indicates whether a UPF supporting interworking with EPS is discovered.
true: A UPF supporting interworking with EPS is requested to be discovered;
false: A UPF not supporting interworking with EPS is requested to be discovered.

row.entry: If included, this IE contains the PLMN ID that a CHF supports (that is, in the PlmnRange of ChfInfo attribute in the NFProfile). This IE is included when the target NF type is CHF.

Preferred target NF location (For example: geographic location, data center). When present, the NRF prefers NF profiles with a locality attribute that matches the preferred-locality. The NRF returns additional NFs in the response not matching the preferred target NF location, For example. if no NF profile is found matching the preferred target NF location. The NRF should set a lower priority for any additional NFs on the response not matching the preferred target NF location than those matching the preferred target NF location.
If included, this IE contains the Access type which is required to be supported by the target Network Function such as SMF.

entry.p: List of features required to be supported by the target Network Function.

This IE is present only if the service-names attribute is present and if it contains a single service-name, or if the target Network Function does not support any service. It is ignored by the NRF otherwise.

row.entry: List of features required to be supported by the target Network Function, as defined by the supportedFeatures attribute in NFService. This IE is present only if the service-names attribute is present. When present, the required-features attribute must contain as many entries as the number of entries in the service-names attribute. The nth entry in the required-features attribute must correspond to the nth entry in the service-names attribute. An entry corresponding to a service for which no specific feature is required is encoded as 0.
This query parameter is used to override the default logical relationship of query parameters.
Maximum number of NFProfiles to be returned in the response.

Maximum payload size (before compression, if any) of the response, expressed in kilo octets. When present, the NRF must limit the number of NF profiles returned in the response such as to not exceed the maximum payload size indicated in the request. Default = 124. Maximum = 2000 (that is, 2 Mo).
List of the PDU session types requested to be supported by the target Network Function, such as UPF.

section.title: NF SUBSCRIPTION
section.p: When a service operation creates a subscription, an NF service consumer requests to be notified during the NF instances of a given set. The filter criteria is registered or de-registered in the NRF server or when the profile is modified.

When a service operation creates a subscription to a specific NF instance, an NF service consumer requests to be notified when the profile of such NF instance is modified or the NF instance is de-registered from the NRF server.

The subscription to notifications on the NF instances is executed by creating a new individual resource under the collection resource subscriptions. The operation is invoked by issuing a POST request on the URI representing the subscriptions resource.

The NFStatusSubscribe is triggered when a new NFSubscriptionData is created. The created subscription data is sent as a POST request to the selected NRF server. In subscription data, a call back URI is sent on which the NFStatusNotify is triggered.
The NFStatusNotify is received from the NRF server as a POST request.

p.b: Update of subscription to NF instances

sectiondiv.p: The subscription to notifications on NF Instances is updated to refresh the validity time, when this time is about to expire. The NF service consumer requests a new validity time to the NRF server and the NRF answers with the new assigned validity time when the operation is successful.
This operation is executed by updating the resource identified by the subscriptionID. It is invoked by issuing an HTTP PATCH request on the URI representing the individual resource.
The following parameters in the table stores the runtime status of subscriptions:

row.entry: Indicates the subscription ID created by the operator.
Indicates the subscription ID returned from the NRF server.
Indicates the validity time returned from the NRF server.
Indicates the validity time sent to the NRF Server by the NCC.
Indicates the resource URI returned from the NRF server.
Indicates the Server ID of the NRF server.
Indicates the status code returned from the NRF server.
Indicates the status message returned from the NRF server.

entry.p: Supported value range is as follows:

row.entry: Indicates the ID of the NRF server.

entry.p: Indicates the following protocol to be used for creating the call back URI:

row.entry: If the value is True, then the auto renewal of the subscription is required.
If the autoRenew is True, then the validity interval is Mandatory.
Indicates the time unit in min, hour, days format

entry.p: Indicates the NF_REGISTER, DEREGISTER, and PROFILE_CHANGE.
If this attribute is null for all three notifications, then all 3 types are considered.

row.entry: If the attribute is present, then this attribute contains the target PLMN ID of the NF Instances whose status is requested to be monitored.

entry.p: Indicates the subscriber condition among the following seven condition type and its corresponding values:

row.entry: Indicates the monitoredAttributes or unmonitoredAttributes and its values (list of string).
Indicates the ID of the NRF server.

entry.p: Indicates the URL that represents the NRF server. Using this URL, the NCC communicates with the NRF server.
Note: When there is an http proxy in between the NCC and NRF server, the IP address of the proxy server must be specified.

row.entry: Indicates the access token URI when the OAuth is used for communication between the NCC and NRF server.
Indicates the number of retries for registration, deregistration or discovery when the NCC is unable communicate with the NRF server during the first attempt.
Indicates the failed heartbeat threshold used to switch to another NRF server (as the current HB failure has reached the threshold level).

entry.p: Indicates the authentication type between the NCC and NRF server. The value range is as follows:

row.entry: Indicates the username when any of the NRF server is present.
Indicates the password when any of NRF server is present.
Indicates the communication time out timing between the NCC and NRF server in millisecond.
Indicates the probe timer in seconds. It defines the interval between two probe request between the NCC and primary NRF server.
Indicates the number of success probe count that defines the primary NRF server as stable and to make it as inUse.
When the value is true, the NRF server is defined as primary NRF server.
Indicates the currently in use NRF server by NCC for 5G calls (primary or secondary NRF server).

section.title: NFStatusUnSubscribe
section.p: This service operation removes an existing subscription to the notifications. It is executed by deleting a given resource identified by a subscriptionID. The operation is invoked by issuing a DELETE request on the URI representing the specific subscription.

section.title: NFStatusNotify
section.p: This service operation notifies each NF service consumer that has previously subscribed to the receiving notifications of registration or deregistration of the NF Instances, or the NF profile notification changes of a given NF Instance. The notification is sent to a callback URI that each NF service consumer provided during the subscription.
The operation is invoked by issuing a POST request to each callback URI of the different subscribed NF Instances.
